lines.text: Enter QUINCE, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING

lines.speaker: quince
lines.text: Have you sent to Bottoms house  is he come home yet

lines.speaker: starveling
lines.text: He cannot be heard of. Out of doubt he is transported.

lines.speaker: flute
lines.text: If he come not, then the play is marred: it goes not forward, doth it

lines.speaker: quince
lines.text: It is not possible: you have not a man in all Athens able to discharge Pyramus but he.

lines.speaker: flute
lines.text: No, he hath simply the best wit of any handicraft man in Athens.

lines.speaker: quince
lines.text: Yea and the best person too and he is a very paramour for a sweet voice.

lines.speaker: flute
lines.text: You must say paragon: a paramour is, God bless us, a thing of naught.

lines.speaker: snug
lines.text: Masters, the duke is coming from the temple, and there is two or three lords and ladies more married: if our sport had gone forward, we had all been made men.

lines.speaker: flute
lines.text: O sweet bully Bottom! Thus hath he lost sixpence a day during his life he could not have scaped sixpence a day: an the duke had not given him sixpence a day for playing Pyramus, Ill be hanged he would have deserved it: sixpence a day in Pyramus, or nothing.

lines.speaker: bottom
lines.text: Where are these lads where are these hearts

lines.speaker: quince
lines.text: Bottom! O most courageous day! O most happy hour!

lines.speaker: bottom
lines.text: Masters, I am to discourse wonders: but ask me not what for if I tell you, I am no true Athenian. I will tell you every thing, right as it fell out.

lines.speaker: bottom
lines.text: Not a word of me. All that I will tell you is, that the duke hath dined. Get your apparel together, good strings to your beards, new ribbons to your pumps meet presently at the palace every man look oer his part for the short and the long is, our play is preferred. In any case, let Thisby have clean linen and let not him that plays the lion pair his nails, for they shall hang out for the lions claws. And, most dear actors, eat no onions nor garlic, for we are to utter sweet breath and I do not doubt but to hear them say, it is a sweet comedy. No more words: away! go, away!
